GOD.content: re: test God imposed on Abraham, where, all the way to hyperbole, “not meaning to say (de ne pas vouloir dire)” (keeping a secret) = not being able to mean (to say) (ne pas pouvoir vouloir dire)
GOD.linkedContent: re: test God imposed on Abraham, where, all the way to hyperbole, “not meaning to say (de ne pas vouloir dire)” (keeping a secret) = not being able to mean (to say) (ne pas pouvoir vouloir dire)

SPOM.content: l’épreuve de l’indécidabilitié & “it is necessary” of emancipatory desire > condition of re-politicization, perhaps another concept of political
SPOM.linkedContent: l’épreuve de l’indécidabilitié & “it is necessary” of emancipatory desire > condition of re-politicization, perhaps another concept of political

HERP.content: an originary enmity in Heidegger, Feindschaft, gives a reconciliation btwn friendship & enmity, a reconciliation carried in the same ordeal (épreuve), in non-identical-sameness
HERP.linkedContent: an originary enmity in Heidegger, Feindschaft, gives a reconciliation btwn friendship & enmity, a reconciliation carried in the same ordeal (épreuve), in non-identical-sameness

F.content: forums are politico-juridical instances, require a third, a witness (like a duel), tribunal instruisant un procès, mettant en cause
F.linkedContent: forums are politico-juridical instances, require a third, a witness (like a duel), tribunal instruisant un procès, mettant en cause

F.content: any judicial thought of the Thing [chose, causa (also, “thing” in Old English means “assembly”)] also thinks that the trial (procès) should not have taken place, did not have place > not an acquittal, but that the space of acquittal should never have been constituted > trauma and “contradictory” incorporation should never have taken place
F.linkedContent: any judicial thought of the Thing [chose, causa (also, “thing” in Old English means “assembly”)] also thinks that the trial (procès) should not have taken place, did not have place > not an acquittal, but that the space of acquittal should never have been constituted > trauma and “contradictory” incorporation should never have taken place

FWT.content: Derrida’s wares are more perverse, contraband, than his father’s (sees his father as exemplary figure of the victim, of “sacrifice,” voûté); perhaps Derrida is avenging his father by introducing disorder into “commerce,” whose trial he would be organizing
FWT.linkedContent: Derrida’s wares are more perverse, contraband, than his father’s (sees his father as exemplary figure of the victim, of “sacrifice,” voûté); perhaps Derrida is avenging his father by introducing disorder into “commerce,” whose trial he would be organizing

POOF.content: hexis binds 2x in same time, such contretemporality another name for psukhé, accounts for, registers, l’épreuve du temps, withholds (en garder) its trace in the body [by way of inscription] > the yoke effect
POOF.linkedContent: hexis binds 2x in same time, such contretemporality another name for psukhé, accounts for, registers, l’épreuve du temps, withholds (en garder) its trace in the body [by way of inscription] > the yoke effect

POOF.content: event of death reveals/effaces ‘truth’ of friendship, oblivion is necessary, faut l’oubli > friendship w/out memory, by gentleness & rigor of fidelity, friendship for the solitary > Nietzsche already demanded “community w/out community”: la mort est l’épreuve suprême de cette déliaison
POOF.linkedContent: event of death reveals/effaces ‘truth’ of friendship, oblivion is necessary, faut l’oubli > friendship w/out memory, by gentleness & rigor of fidelity, friendship for the solitary > Nietzsche already demanded “community w/out community”: la mort est l’épreuve suprême de cette déliaison

ROP.content: sans ce double bind et sans l'épreuve de l'aporie qu'il détermine, w/out its thousands and thousands of knots of passion, all would be program, no event/decision/place would ever take place (double bind can be “pathological,” but no more than pathetic figures of death)
ROP.linkedContent: sans ce double bind et sans l'épreuve de l'aporie qu'il détermine, w/out its thousands and thousands of knots of passion, all would be program, no event/decision/place would ever take place (double bind can be “pathological,” but no more than pathetic figures of death)

ROP.content: Foucault pulls back from (admits impasses of) epistēmē > mais seul ceux qui travaillent, seuls ceux qui prennent des risques en travaillant rencontrent des difficultés > responsibility dans l’épreuve de l’aporie
ROP.linkedContent: Foucault pulls back from (admits impasses of) epistēmē > mais seul ceux qui travaillent, seuls ceux qui prennent des risques en travaillant rencontrent des difficultés > responsibility dans l’épreuve de l’aporie

SW.content: infinite finite trial (implacable suspicion) that you impose on yourself to not want what you know you want (the due date of such a verdict)?
SW.linkedContent: infinite finite trial (implacable suspicion) that you impose on yourself to not want what you know you want (the due date of such a verdict)?

RGE.content: Lordship’s putting at stake of life (mettre en jeu, Daransetzen des Lebens) has meaning, it’s a moment in constitution of meaning, presentation of essence, truth
RGE.linkedContent: Lordship’s putting at stake of life (mettre en jeu, Daransetzen des Lebens) has meaning, it’s a moment in constitution of meaning, presentation of essence, truth

RGE.content: for history (that is, meaning) to form a continuous chain, to be woven (se trame), master must experience his truth (éprouve sa vérité) (must stay alive once raised above life)
RGE.linkedContent: for history (that is, meaning) to form a continuous chain, to be woven (se trame), master must experience his truth (éprouve sa vérité) (must stay alive once raised above life)

REST.content: temptation to stand shoes upright again, to return them to authentic subject: la structure de la chose et du procès oblige, alors, toujours, à en rajouter (to keep adding to it) > to put back becomes a supplementary retortion, delirious dramaturgy > these shoes are hallucinogenic
REST.linkedContent: temptation to stand shoes upright again, to return them to authentic subject: la structure de la chose et du procès oblige, alors, toujours, à en rajouter (to keep adding to it) > to put back becomes a supplementary retortion, delirious dramaturgy > these shoes are hallucinogenic

REST.content: everything on trial (tout chose en procès), publicized [re: Shapiro], the proximate cause is a trap: a double that doesn’t make a pair, makes a trap, can’t put one’s feet in them, Christic shade of bait [sole? proper subject? Van Gogh’s surrender?], Christ’s flesh is bait for the Devil (Muscipula Diaboli)
REST.linkedContent: everything on trial (tout chose en procès), publicized [re: Shapiro], the proximate cause is a trap: a double that doesn’t make a pair, makes a trap, can’t put one’s feet in them, Christic shade of bait [sole? proper subject? Van Gogh’s surrender?], Christ’s flesh is bait for the Devil (Muscipula Diaboli)

REST.content: all the steps of trial are traps [Heidegger assigning sole of shoe, Shapiro sending letter], as if figured in advance: to whom is the trap due (à qui revient le piège)? des chausse-trapes, des lacets, des pièges à lacets (laces of the shoes)
REST.linkedContent: all the steps of trial are traps [Heidegger assigning sole of shoe, Shapiro sending letter], as if figured in advance: to whom is the trap due (à qui revient le piège)? des chausse-trapes, des lacets, des pièges à lacets (laces of the shoes)

REST.content: comes down to a decision about the frame, a border (bordure) which is double in its trait: joins together what it splits (partage): “at stake are (il y va) all the interests caught up in the trial (procès) of this split (partage),” what separates external from internal > a police inquiry, inquiry into the police: police always more & other than what one might want to limit under this name
REST.linkedContent: comes down to a decision about the frame, a border (bordure) which is double in its trait: joins together what it splits (partage): “at stake are (il y va) all the interests caught up in the trial (procès) of this split (partage),” what separates external from internal > a police inquiry, inquiry into the police: police always more & other than what one might want to limit under this name

DST.content: [re: Lacoue-Labarthe’s désistance] exemplary, superior probity that, w/out ceding to dogmatic moralism, submits ethical demand to trial (l’épreuve) of thought
DST.linkedContent: [re: Lacoue-Labarthe’s désistance] exemplary, superior probity that, w/out ceding to dogmatic moralism, submits ethical demand to trial (l’épreuve) of thought

DST.content: Lacoue-Labarthe’s subject proves and undergoes (fait la preuve et l’épreuve) the contrary > identifies itself by way of désistance that makes absolute identification impossible
DST.linkedContent: Lacoue-Labarthe’s subject proves and undergoes (fait la preuve et l’épreuve) the contrary > identifies itself by way of désistance that makes absolute identification impossible

HST.content: Jew of any time, especially this century, undergoes l’épreuve (test, ordeal, trial) of impossibility of forgiveness
HST.linkedContent: Jew of any time, especially this century, undergoes l’épreuve (test, ordeal, trial) of impossibility of forgiveness

HST.content: impossibility of forgiveness must be thought onto la racine la plus radicale of its paradox—it does not resist the impossibility of what wants to be conceived in it > concept of concept undergoes l’épreuve of its essential precariousness, its finitude, its deconstructability
HST.linkedContent: impossibility of forgiveness must be thought onto la racine la plus radicale of its paradox—it does not resist the impossibility of what wants to be conceived in it > concept of concept undergoes l’épreuve of its essential precariousness, its finitude, its deconstructability

HST.content: forgiveness merges (se confondre) w/ l’épreuve of aporia: possibility of impossible, impossible of the possible
HST.linkedContent: forgiveness merges (se confondre) w/ l’épreuve of aporia: possibility of impossible, impossible of the possible

HST.content: limit (of forgiveness) cannot be crossed (infranchissable)—and is crossed insofar as it can’t be [hymen] > ultimate compassion, very test of substitution (impossible), to be hostage and hôte of the other
HST.linkedContent: limit (of forgiveness) cannot be crossed (infranchissable)—and is crossed insofar as it can’t be [hymen] > ultimate compassion, very test of substitution (impossible), to be hostage and hôte of the other

HST.content: 397 the definition of (a) today, sursis de vie, reconciliation in the impossible > great forgiveness as test/ordeal of unforgivable [re: 2 enemy Jews comically forgiving each other]
HST.linkedContent: 397 the definition of (a) today, sursis de vie, reconciliation in the impossible > great forgiveness as test/ordeal of unforgivable [re: 2 enemy Jews comically forgiving each other]

LI.content: Derrida imagines himself on trial for quoting all of Sarl’s Reply
LI.linkedContent: Derrida imagines himself on trial for quoting all of Sarl’s Reply

LI.content: always police & tribunal there when a rule is invoked [re: context, event, signature], because conventions can be violated (in themselves and by fictionality that constitutes them)
LI.linkedContent: always police & tribunal there when a rule is invoked [re: context, event, signature], because conventions can be violated (in themselves and by fictionality that constitutes them)

TN.content: let’s not play w/ words ever: le tendre ne s’éprouve qu’à tendre (the proof of the tender is only in the tending, extending)
TN.linkedContent: let’s not play w/ words ever: le tendre ne s’éprouve qu’à tendre (the proof of the tender is only in the tending, extending)

TN.content: “cet espacement fait l’épreuve du non-contact comme la condition ou l’expérience même du contact, l’expérience même du même à jamais ouverte (forever open)—et par l’autre espacée” [hiatus of noncontact at heart of contact]
TN.linkedContent: “cet espacement fait l’épreuve du non-contact comme la condition ou l’expérience même du contact, l’expérience même du même à jamais ouverte (forever open)—et par l’autre espacée” [hiatus of noncontact at heart of contact]

TN.content: il faut s’aimer [French grammar: puts transitivity in reflexivity] says every “I love you” > this (impossible) auto-affection of love makes love possible
TN.linkedContent: il faut s’aimer [French grammar: puts transitivity in reflexivity] says every “I love you” > this (impossible) auto-affection of love makes love possible

TN.content: compassion, if there is any: l’épreuve of impossible compatibility
TN.linkedContent: compassion, if there is any: l’épreuve of impossible compatibility

AD.content: questions of eschatological hospitality not posed (posent) in repose of place, they put one to the test (mettent à l’épreuve) of an interrogation that endures sans repos
AD.linkedContent: questions of eschatological hospitality not posed (posent) in repose of place, they put one to the test (mettent à l’épreuve) of an interrogation that endures sans repos

LG.content: “avant d’en venir à l’épreuve d’un certain exemple, je tenterai de formuler…” [formulate before the ordeal, test, proof of an example, i.e. Blanchot]
LG.linkedContent: “avant d’en venir à l’épreuve d’un certain exemple, je tenterai de formuler…” [formulate before the ordeal, test, proof of an example, i.e. Blanchot]

LG.content: l’épreuve of a récit brought to light the madness of genre—spinning (faire tourner) Peterson’s genre-disc, comme un soleil fou > dividing borders btwn literature and its others
LG.linkedContent: l’épreuve of a récit brought to light the madness of genre—spinning (faire tourner) Peterson’s genre-disc, comme un soleil fou > dividing borders btwn literature and its others

CIN.content: (ici s’éprouve la force implacable du sens, of mediation, of the negative) all-burning must pass into its contrary, guard itself: as soon as fire shows itself: il reste, il se retient, it loses itself as fire
CIN.linkedContent: (ici s’éprouve la force implacable du sens, of mediation, of the negative) all-burning must pass into its contrary, guard itself: as soon as fire shows itself: il reste, il se retient, it loses itself as fire
